text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with shrimp toast
that's right remember that time you went
to your friends to watch the game but
instead of the usual chips and dips that
lady made that thing that was so
delicious you're still talking about it
and that was like years ago well my
friends this could be that thing and you
could be that lady and the great news
here besides the same being gorgeous and
very very delicious it is incredibly
easy to make as you're about to see
because basically we're just dumping
everything in a food processor and
making a paste and that everything we're
going to be dumping starts with some raw
shrimp and yes I did say raw shrimp this
just won't work with cooked shrimp so
don't even try it and of course if these
came with the tails on you're going to
pull those off those would add an odd
and very dangerous texture and then to
our raw shrimp we're also going to want
to add some water chestnut which for me
come slice in these little cans sure one
day I'd like to use fresh water chestnut
but I'm not even sure if that's a thing
so I'm going to settle for these as I
have for the last thirty years and even
though we're going to blend this all
into a paste in the food processor I do
want to chop up my ingredients before
they go in I think everything is going
to mix a lot better but having said that
some people just dump it all in and
blend it together but I do think this
works a little better if you give things
a chop first and then besides that we're
also going to add some chopped cilantro
as well as some sliced green onions also
known as scallions we're also going to
do some chopped garlic as well as some
freshly grated ginger root and then
believe it or not we're also going to
add one and Cho V filet I figured since
we're not going to add any actual msg
we'll add some Italian msg so these
ingredients going to form the base of
our shrimp paste but we still need to
add some additional flavorings and
seasonings so let's do our liquids first
which will include a little bit of
toasted sesame oil and not too much
because that can be overpowering so just
about a teaspoon and then we'll also
give it a little bit of Asian fish sauce
which despite the Outer Roma when you're
using it always provides a little bit of
extra savoriness and then we're
definitely going to give this a nice
shot of soy sauce and no not low-sodium
we want to go full sodium here and then
to help bind this mixture up a little
bit we're going to add one egg white so
we will separate an egg and just add the
white and at this point we can go ahead
and season it up
the final ingredients so let's go ahead
and add a pinch of sugar and why a
little sugar for some sweetness and then
let's also do a little touch of paprika
followed by oh yes a little shake of
cayenne and then last but not least a
tiny pinch of salt and be careful we
already added several salty ingredients
which reminds me we'll talk a little bit
about seasoning for this on the blog
post and then once we have everything in
there we're simply going to process this
into a paste so we'll start as usual by
pulsing on and off to get it going and
of course whenever we start something
like this we're always going to get big
chunks that fly up and stick to the
sides
hey that's what big chunks do so we
always want to do once it gets started
is stop
remove the lid and take a spatula and
scrape it all down and that way we
ensure everything is going to get mixed
in so we'll give that a scraping and we
will continue processing until like I
said we have what can best be described
as a shrimp paste and if everything's
gone according to plan it should look
something like this which is really not
that easy to see in here so let's go
ahead and transfer this to a bowl so you
can get a better look at the texture and
that is it our shrimp paste is done and
we can use this immediately if we want
or we can simply wrap it up and pop it
in the fridge until needed and for what
it's worth I do think this comes out a
little better if we give those flavors a
little time to develop but either way
when you are ready to serve this is how
we're going to do final assembly and as
you may or may not know the base of
shrimp toast is white bread yes they
still make white bread and while most
people use the slice as is I suggest
toasting that just a little bit see how
we have just a little bit of color on
that I think by giving this a little
brief toasting first it's easier to work
with and Fries up a little better and
then what we'll do before we spread on
the mixture is cut off the crusts which
a lot of people like to do after they
spread the mixture on but then you
always lose mixture so I firmly believe
you should always trim it before you
spread but that's up to you you are the
host of this toast and then all we need
to do is take a fork and spread over
enough mixture to cover and what I
always try to shoot for is to have the
mixture exactly the same thickness as
the bread but of course if you want to
add a little more or a little less feel
free and then once our mixture is spread
we'll go ahead and cut these
and to the geometric shape of your
choice we can do rectangles we could do
squares or in this case triangles you've
heard me say before people love pointy
food and as soon as those are cut the
ready to fry and right here's a great
shot to see what I was talking about I
basically have an equal ratio between
the shrimp paste and the toast but
anyway once our mixture has been spread
on and we've cut our toast we are ready
to fry so let's head over to the stove
where I have about a half inch of
vegetable oil set over medium-high heat
and a great way to test if your oil is
ready is with a little scrap of bread if
you dip it in and it starts bubbling
enthusiastically you're ready to fry so
once our oil is hot we will place those
very carefully shrimp pace I'd down and
we will cook thee for approximately two
to three minutes per side or until our
bread is nicely browned and crispy so it
really does depend on the size and
thickness but ballpark it's going to be
about two to three minutes per side okay
and right here you can get a great look
at how the bottom should look okay we
don't a burner but we really do want
those well browned and once we determine
those have cooked long enough we will
remove those to a paper towel to drain a
little bit and then let me show you
something here you never want to do the
tops of these two looked a little
lighter than the other ones so I flipped
them back over for a little extra
browning but the problem is if you start
flipping these back and forth they do
absorb a lot more oil okay so why did I
do it because I wanted them to look a
little darker for the picture so yes in
other words a dumb reason but anyway the
point is if you can just flip them once
and once those have drained for a couple
seconds on a paper towel they are ready
to serve yes these are definitely better
served hot or warm so we can go ahead
and transfer those onto a tray or plate
or whatever the heck this thing is and
maybe we'll top those with a little
extra green onion
quite possibly cut on the bias and
that's it our shrimp toasts are done and
if you haven't had these before you are
in for a huge treat these are one of the
great hot party snacks of all time just
a beautiful combination of that soft
savory moist shrimp paste and that
crispy fried toast I mean come on how is
that not going to be amazing it's just
ridiculously good and extremely
addictive so please eat responsibly so I
really did think these came out
incredibly well although after I made
this batch I did remember your spell
so sprinkle them with sesame seeds
before you fry em which I did to another
batch that I made into squares and I
fried those up and those sesame seeds
did look beautiful but if I'm being
honest they really didn't taste that
differently from the triangle batch but
as I mentioned it did like the
appearance so next time I believe I'll
combine these two efforts and do
triangles with sesame seeds that is one
of the great things about cooking
there's always a next time
it's a very comforting thought but
regardless square triangle with seeds or
sand seeds these things are gorgeous
delicious and fairly easy to make so I
really do hope you give these a try soon
head over to food wishes comm for all
the ingredient amounts and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
